metadata.title: CVE-2022-36314 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When opening a Windows shortcut from the local filesystem, an attackercould supply a remote path that would lead to unexpected network requestsfrom the operating system.
This bug only affects Firefox for Windows.Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affectsFirefox ESR < 102.1, Firefox < 103, and Thunderbird < 102.1. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
